Platform.Title: Nimblegen Salmonella enterica 5.0k array v1.0
Platform.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium str. LT2
Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Enteritidis
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: 385K DNA array prepared with Maskless Array Synthesizer (MAS) technology. See manufacturer's website at http://www.nimblegen.com/.
Platform.Description: NimbleGen design name 2006-08-22_Zhang_60mer, NimbleGen design ID 4587. Standard expression design for Salmonella typhimurium covering NC_003197, NC_003277, and 500 genes from Salmonella enteritidis. Probes selected for 5027/5027 sequences. Median number of probes/sequence is 19 with an average of 19.00. Each probe will be replicated 4 times on the chip. Probes are randomly distributed over the surface of the array. Unused features have been filled with randomly generated probes of comparable GC content. native array description file: .ndf native array description file: .ngd

Column.Name: BLOCK
Column.Description: The number of the probe replicates. There are 4 probe replicates, therefore 4 blocks for each target sequence

Sample.Title: BHI_Enteritidis_chlorine_control_rep1

Channel.Organism: Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Enteritidis
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were washed and resuspended in (1) BHI broth, 30 min (2) chlorinated BHI broth, 130 ppm, 30 min (3) chlorinated BHI broth, 390 ppm, 10 min
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Salmonella Enteritidis and Typhimurium were grown to early-log phase at 37°C in BHI broth
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Midi kit (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen). RNA quality and concentration was determined by analysis with an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI, USA following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: This sample is of Salmonella enterica Enteritidis in BHI broth. It is the first of three biological replicates used in this experiment, each from separate cultures.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to RMA (Robust Multi-Array Analysis; Irizarry et al. Biostatistics 4(2):249), quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package, version 2.5 (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were washed and resuspended in (1) BHI broth, 30 min (2) chlorinated BHI broth, 130 ppm, 30 min (3) chlorinated BHI broth, 390 ppm, 10 min
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Salmonella Enteritidis and Typhimurium were grown to early-log phase at 37°C in BHI broth
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was extracted using the RNeasy Midi kit (Qiagen Inc., Valencia, CA, USA) and the RNAprotect reagent (Qiagen). RNA quality and concentration was determined by analysis with an Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Labeling was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI, USA following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanning was performed by NimbleGen Systems Inc., Madison, WI USA, following their standard operating protocol. See www.nimblegen.com.
Sample.Description: This sample is of Salmonella enterica Typhimurium in BHI broth w/ 390ppm chlorine treatment for 10 minutes . It is the third of three biological replicates used in this experiment, each from separate cultures.
Sample.Data-Processing: The raw data (.pair file) was subjected to RMA (Robust Multi-Array Analysis; Irizarry et al. Biostatistics 4(2):249), quantile normalization (Bolstad et al. Bioinformatics 19(2):185), and background correction as implemented in the NimbleScan software package, version 2.5 (Roche NimbleGen, Inc.).

Series.Title: Transcriptomic Profiling of Salmonella enterica Enteritidis and Typhimurium under Chlorine Based Oxidation
Series.Summary: Investigation of whole genome gene expression level changes in Salmonella enterica serova Enteritidis and Typhimurium under chlorine treatment
Series.Overall-Design: An eighteen chip study using total RNA isolated from three separate cultures of (1) S. Enteritidis in BHI broth (2) S. Typhimurium in BHI broth (3) S. Enteritidis in BHI broth w/ 130 ppm chlorine (4) S. Typhimurium in BHI w/ 130 ppm chlorine (5) S. Enteritidis in BHI broth w/ 390 ppm (6) S. Typhimurium in BHI broth w/ 390 ppm. Each chip measures the expression level of 5,027 ORFs covering the whole genome of S. Enteritidis and S. Typhimurium.
